definition: relieved/at ease/feel relieved
to explain/to release/Buddha (abbr. for 釋迦牟尼|释迦牟尼[Shi4 jia1 mou2 ni2])/Buddhism
correct/right/so/thus/like this/-ly

sentences.english: Laurence says he is ‘relaxed’ about increased demands for transparency.
sentences.chinese: 對於不斷增長的透明要求，勞倫斯說他覺得“釋然”。

sentences.english: Knowing that she was off to a great family, I felt relieved.
sentences.chinese: 一想到她嫁了一戶好人家，我也就感到釋然。

sentences.english: As the moonlight brightens the empty mountain, my mind is freed.
sentences.chinese: 明月當頭照空山，心已釋然萬里朗。

sentences.english: Looking at the victorious enemy, I am relieved, put down the bottle, and then turn around and.
sentences.chinese: 望着高呼勝利的敵軍，我釋然，放下酒樽，然後轉身。

sentences.english: The parents seem relieved to hear it.
sentences.chinese: 家長們聽到這種論調似乎很感釋然。

sentences.english: After listening to my explanations, the little lotus flower finally felt relieved.
sentences.chinese: 聽完我的講解，小荷花終於釋然。

sentences.english: Badr-al-Budur saw the love in his eyes, and smiled.
sentences.chinese: 公主從他的眼神裏看到了真情，釋然地笑了。

sentences.english: With enough confirmations in hand, everyone could finally relax.
sentences.chinese: 用足夠的證據在手，所有人最終都釋然了。

sentences.english: When you face your own truth, you’ll find it’s an enormous relief.
sentences.chinese: 當你直面自己的真實情況時，你發現會完全的釋然。

sentences.english: Full of emotion, will be the time to fill, and I will eventually learn relief.
sentences.chinese: 凋落的情感，終將被時間填滿，而我終將學懂釋然。

definition: to release (tension)/relief (from suspense)/to dispel (usu. with negative, unable to forget)
to vanish like smoke in thin air/to disappear
to come to accept an unpleasant fact/to get over sth/to cheer up
to be worried
melancholy/depression
(final particle, same as 吧)
to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish
embarrassed
to forget
to be secretly delighted
a flash of realization/the truth in a flash/a moment of enlightenment (usually Buddhist)
as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly
lit. scattered ashes and dispersed smoke (idiom)/fig. to be annihilated/to vanish in a puff of smoke
to realize suddenly/to wake up with a start
in the end/after all is said and done
to pacify/to calm down/to be cured/to be healed
to recall/to recollect
